snippet: One year after mass violence broke out in South Sudan, battles between government forces and rebels continued, and aid officials said that international assistance was needed to help residents stave off mass hunger.
abstract: Aid groups call for international assistance to South Sudan, which remains riven by battles between government forces and rebels one year after mass violence first broke out; warn that famine could return in 2015 without further aid; also warn that country is at risk of becoming 'yet another forgotten state,' citing waning of concern abroad.
lead_paragraph: One year after mass violence broke out in South Sudan, battles between government forces and rebels continued, and aid officials said that international assistance was needed to help residents stave off mass hunger.

headline.main: South Sudan Faces Famine and Apathy Amid Clashes
headline.print_headline: South Sudan Faces Famine and Apathy Amid Clashes
